objective.answer: The primary objective of the paper is to introduce The AI Scientist-v2, an end-to-end agentic system capable of autonomously generating peer-review-accepted workshop papers by formulating hypotheses, designing experiments, analyzing data, and authoring manuscripts.
objective.evidence: We introduce The AI Scientist-v2, an end-to-end agentic system capable of producing the first entirely AI-generated peer-review-accepted workshop paper.

knowledge_gap.answer: The paper addresses the gap in fully autonomous scientific discovery systems that can generalize across diverse machine learning domains without relying on human-authored code templates.
knowledge_gap.evidence: However, significant limitations constrained its broad applicability and autonomy. Specifically, it relied heavily on human-authored code templates requiring manual effort to create a new template for each new topic area.

answer: Elimination of dependency on human-authored code templates, increasing system autonomy.
Introduction of an experiment manager agent with a novel agentic tree-search algorithm for deeper exploration.
Integration of a Vision-Language Model (VLM) feedback mechanism to enhance figure quality and manuscript clarity.
evidence: First, we eliminate the dependency on human-provided code templates, significantly increasing the system’s autonomy.
Second, we introduce an experiment manager agent coupled with a novel agentic tree-search algorithm, enabling deeper and more systematic exploration of complex hypotheses.

Third, we enhance the reviewing and refinement stages by integrating a Vision-Language Model (VLM)-based feedback mechanism, improving the quality, clarity, and alignment of generated figures, captions, and text interpretation.

inspirational_papers.answer: - Lu et al. (2024) The AI Scientist-v1 demonstrated the feasibility of a fully automated scientific workflow and downstream manuscript production. (Methodological precursors)
inspirational_papers.evidence: A notable recent advance in this direction is The AI Scientist-v1 (Lu et al., 2024), which demonstrated the feasibility of a fully automated scientific workflow and downstream manuscript production.

steps.evidence: The system is prompted to engage in more open-ended thinking about potential research directions, hypotheses, and experimental designs.

The AI Scientist-v2 proceeds with experimentation. Beyond the code-conditioned idea generation, The AI Scientist-v1 also depended on the predefined template code as a starting baseline implementation.

Finally, we streamline the manuscript writing phase by replacing the incremental, Aider-based (Gauthier, 2024) iterative writing approach of The AI Scientist-v1 with a simpler, single-pass generation followed by a separate reflection stage powered by reasoning models such as o1 (OpenAI, 2024).

tools.name: Vision-Language Model (VLM)
tools.description: Used for feedback on generated figures and manuscript clarity
tools.evidence: We enhance the reviewing and refinement stages by integrating a Vision-Language Model (VLM)-based feedback mechanism.

tools.name: Agentic Tree Search
tools.description: Used for systematic exploration of complex hypotheses
tools.evidence: We introduce an experiment manager agent coupled with a novel agentic tree-search algorithm, enabling deeper and more systematic exploration of complex hypotheses.

benchmark_datasets.name: ICLR 2025 workshop dataset
benchmark_datasets.data_description: Data used for evaluating AI-generated manuscripts
benchmark_datasets.usage: Used for submission and evaluation of AI-generated papers
benchmark_datasets.evidence: We evaluated The AI Scientist-v2 by submitting three fully autonomous manuscripts to a peer-reviewed workshop at ICLR.

evaluation_metrics.name: Reviewer score
evaluation_metrics.purpose: Measures the quality of AI-generated manuscripts
evaluation_metrics.application: Used to evaluate the acceptance of AI-generated papers
evaluation_metrics.evidence: One manuscript achieved an average reviewer score of 6.33 (placing it roughly in the top 45% of submissions).

methods.name: Hypothesis or Idea Generation
methods.description: The system produces candidate hypotheses or new research ideas from prior knowledge or external input.
methods.evidence: The system is prompted to engage in more open-ended thinking about potential research directions, hypotheses, and experimental designs.

methods.name: Experimental design generation
methods.description: The approach includes producing experimental protocols, configurations, or evaluation strategies.
methods.evidence: We introduce an experiment manager agent coupled with a novel agentic tree-search algorithm, enabling deeper and more systematic exploration of complex hypotheses.

areas.name: Interdisciplinary Sciences
areas.description: The paper develops an AI system for automated scientific discovery across various domains.
areas.evidence: The AI Scientist-v2 eliminates the reliance on human-authored code templates, generalizes effectively across diverse machine learning domains.

performance_summary.summary: The AI Scientist-v2 successfully generated a manuscript that passed peer review at a workshop, marking a milestone for AI-generated research.
performance_summary.evidence: One manuscript achieved high enough scores to exceed the average human acceptance threshold, marking the first instance of a fully AI-generated paper successfully navigating a peer review.

baselines.name: The AI Scientist-v1
baselines.description: Previous version of the AI system for scientific discovery.
baselines.evidence: Compared to its predecessor (v1, Lu et al., 2024), The AI Scientist-v2 eliminates the reliance on human-authored code templates.

benchmark_datasets.name: ICLR 2025 workshop dataset
benchmark_datasets.data_description: Data used for evaluating AI-generated manuscripts
benchmark_datasets.usage: Used for submission and evaluation of AI-generated papers
benchmark_datasets.evidence: We evaluated The AI Scientist-v2 by submitting three fully autonomous manuscripts to a peer-reviewed workshop at ICLR.

evaluation_metrics.name: Reviewer score
evaluation_metrics.purpose: Measures the quality of AI-generated manuscripts
evaluation_metrics.application: Used to evaluate the acceptance of AI-generated papers
evaluation_metrics.evidence: One manuscript achieved an average reviewer score of 6.33 (placing it roughly in the top 45% of submissions).

benchmark_dataset.evidence: No traditional benchmark dataset was used; the study focused on AI-generated manuscripts evaluated at a workshop.

limitations.name: Workshop-Level Acceptance
limitations.description: The AI-generated manuscript was accepted at a workshop level, not a main conference track, indicating room for improvement.
limitations.evidence: The acceptance occurred at a workshop level rather than at the main conference track, and only one of the three AI-generated submissions was accepted.

limitations.name: Limited Exploration of Novel Hypotheses
limitations.description: The system may struggle with formulating genuinely novel, high-impact hypotheses.
limitations.evidence: Certain aspects of scientific inquiry—such as formulating genuinely novel, high-impact hypotheses—remain challenging for purely automated systems.

future_directions.name: Enhance Novel Hypothesis Generation
future_directions.description: Improve the system's ability to generate novel, high-impact scientific hypotheses.
future_directions.evidence: Addressing these limitations in future iterations will be essential to move beyond preliminary or incremental scientific results toward consistently high-quality, conference-level contributions.

future_directions.name: Expand Dataset Handling
future_directions.description: Automate the data preparation process to handle a broader range of datasets.
future_directions.evidence: Automating this data preparation process further to handle a broader range of datasets remains an interesting direction for future research.

resource_link.evidence: We have open-sourced the code at https://github.com/SakanaAI/AI-Scientist-v2 to foster the future development of this transformative technology.
